alert.note: Alert for Evangeline; Northern Acadia; St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 6:58PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Evangeline, northeastern Acadia and southwestern St. Landry Parishes through 800 PM CDT... At 657 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chataignier to Swords. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Opelousas, Church Point, Leonville, Sunset, Grand Coteau, Cankton, Chataignier, Lawtell, Swords, Prairie Ronde and Savoy. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 9 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
